title: Omnidirectional Image Quality Captioning: A Large-scale Database and A New Model
author: Jiebin Yan (Jiangxi University of Finance and Economics), Ziwen Tan, Yuming Fang, Junjie Chen, Wenhui Jiang, Zhou Wang (University of Waterloo)
relevance_why: The proposed IQCaption360 model and the methodology of generating quality captions could be beneficial in enhancing audio captioning tasks, particularly in generating descriptive audio representations based on visual quality assessments.
background: Creating a model for generating quality captions for omnidirectional images, which helps assess and describe visual quality in a more nuanced way, rather than simply providing a numerical score.
contribution: This paper introduces the OIQ-10K database and the IQCaption360 model to solve the problem of omnidirectional image quality assessment and captioning, achieving improved performance over existing methods.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous objective models for omnidirectional image quality assessment often oversimplified the assessment by providing a single quality score.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work enhances the assessment by generating detailed captions describing the quality and distortion types, offering a richer representation of image quality.

key_innovation: The unique aspect of this model is its ability to generate textual quality captions based on complex distortions in omnidirectional images, integrating visual and textual analysis.
real_world_impact: This work can potentially improve applications in virtual reality and immersive environments by providing better quality assessments, ultimately enhancing user experiences in visual media.

new_terms.omnidirectional images: **Omnidirectional images** are photographs that capture all 360 degrees of a scene, allowing immersive viewing experiences.

open_sourcing: The OIQ-10K database and related source codes are available at https://github.com/WenJuing/IQCaption360.
